image.altText: Man stands at a podium giving a speech

props.synopsis: Australian Security Intelligence Organisation director general Mike Burgess has provided a few more details about a former politician accused of helping an international spy ring.

title.children: Former politican accused of spying was recruited during term in parliament

image.altText: Smoke plume from bushfire near coastline.

props.synopsis: Strong winds have stopped firefighting aircraft battle a blaze that has forced the evacuation of a caravan park in Tasmania's north.

title.children: Firefighting aircraft grounded due to winds, as fire threatens caravan park in northern Tasmania

image.altText: A man wearing a light blue liberal shirt stands at the front of a group of people who are all tossing their caps in the air.

props.synopsis: For the third election in a row, the Tasmanian Liberal Party comes under fire for its handling of taxpayer-funded community grants, with an integrity expert calling its actions "pork barrelling, plain and simple".

title.children: Premier denies Tasmanian Liberals are 'pork-barrelling their way back in to power'

image.altText: Peter Dutton and Anthony Albanese cross paths in the House of Representatives.Â

props.synopsis: While the Dunkley by-election did nothing to change the electoral map, it offers insights into how Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton will battle the next federal election.

title.children: This by-election changed nothing but it could ultimately change everything

image.altText: A split shot of a woman in  a dress and in running gear.

props.synopsis: A "top priority" investigation, numerous police interviews and a supportive community effort have been features of a search in the month since Ballarat mum Samantha Murphy disappeared.

title.children: No new leads and a tight lid on protracted investigation â what we know about Samantha Murphy's disappearance

image.altText: A water view seen through timber supports and a concrete wall

props.synopsis: A leading Tasmanian construction company is facing a fine of up to $1.55 million after being found guilty of safety breaches that left a worker with serious injuries.

title.children: Construction company facing $1.55m fine over 'horrific' injuries to worker who fell on to star picket

image.altText: The Australian men's cricket team gather on the ground in Wellington to celebrate at the end of a Test match.

props.synopsis: Australia completes a comprehensive victory on day four of the first Test after New Zealand collapse meekly at Basin Reserve to be all out for 179.

title.children: Lyon spins Australia to 172-run victory over New Zealand in first Test

image.altText: LeBron James gestures with his left hand after becoming the first NBA player to reach 40,000 points.

props.synopsis: James adds another milestone to his lengthy list of achievements, as the NBA great looks to put his all-time scoring record further out of reach.

title.children: LeBron James becomes first player to score 40,000 points in NBA

image.altText: A tall Manly NRL player shouts in celebration as he is patted on the head by teammates while opposing players lie on the ground.

props.synopsis: The 2024 NRL season starts in Las Vegas with the Manly Sea Eagles beating South Sydney Rabbitohs 36-24, before the Brisbane Broncos take on the Sydney Roosters at the site of the Super Bowl. Follow live.

title.children: NRL heavyweights Roosters and Broncos face off in Vegas after Manly defeats Souths in try-fest

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: FULL-TIME: Manly wins the season opener in Vegas
Trbojevic brothers combine for a try
The softest try for Manly hooker Lachlan Croker

image.altText: a man stands on a soccer pitch holding a ball under his arm

props.synopsis: Far away from their families in Timor-Leste, these seasonal workers who pick fruit are able to "forget" their worries when they run on to the lush green Tasmanian grass and play soccer.

title.children: Soccer friendly competition uniting Tasmania's fruit picking workforce from Timor-Leste

image.altText: Anthony Albanese with Dunkley candidate Jodie Belyea and his fiancÃ© Jodie Haydon.

props.synopsis: The federal opposition insists it is well placed to win Labor seats at the next election despite falling short in a Victorian by-election last night.

title.children: Coalition optimistic about political fortunes despite Labor retaining Dunkley in by-election

image.altText: A close-up picture of a man handing over a set of house keys to a woman.

props.synopsis: It might make sense financially, but there are potential emotional pitfalls in accepting support from family to get into the property market.

title.children: The hidden costs of borrowing from the 'Bank of Mum and Dad'

image.altText: A calculator on a table with an electricity bill, phone, and pens

props.synopsis: With electricity bills still high, we've compiled a list of the energy-draining appliances that may be spiking your power bill and how to cut costs.

title.children: The six biggest energy guzzlers in your home driving up your power bill â and the best way to run them efficiently

image.altText: A photo of a castle at night in a forest, with everything all lit up by lights.

props.synopsis: Mark and Judy Evans purchased a dilapidated tourist spot with its very own castle 30 years ago. They say its success is due to the park's 100-year history.Â

title.children: There's an almost 100-year-old castle in a Queensland rainforest. How did it get there?

image.altText: Three generations of women stand together, Pounamu is 18, then her grandmother Ihapera, 66, and mother Natasha, 40.

props.synopsis: Last century, children were forced to write lines of 'I will not speak MÄori' as punishment. Now as grandparents, they fear progress around the use of the MÄori language is at stake.Â Â

title.children: 'I will not speak MÄori': Fears new policies in NZ threaten 50 years of progress

image.altText: five colourful vapes standing on a black-coloured counter

props.synopsis: In recent years, there has been a significant rise in vapers under the age of 25 â and so too has the demand for services to help kick the habit.

title.children: Children presenting with 'significant symptoms of withdrawal' from vaping

image.altText: ambulance and cars parked on side of street

props.synopsis: Emergency workers worked through the night to retrieve the body of a woman in her 20s who fell to her death on a hike in the Lamington National Park.Â

title.children: Woman falls to death at popular waterfall in Gold Coast national park

image.altText: Emily Cosson concentating in playing pinball

props.synopsis: At 10, Emily Cosson was the only female at pinball competitions. Then she started beating the grown men. Now, she's part of a trend turning old-school cool again.

title.children: Digital natives resurgence in the popular arcade game has seen world rankings taken over by under 21-year-olds

image.altText: Nathan Lyon celebrates

props.synopsis: Nathan Lyon gets flipped around and rips through the New Zealand line-up, while Rachin Ravindra shows he has plenty to learn in his fledgling Test career. Here are the five quick hits from the fourth day of the first Test at Basin Reserve.

title.children: Five quick hits â Lyon stars, Green wins and an NZ star learns a lesson

image.altText: Tom Gleeson on the set of Hard Quiz gesturing behind him with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Oh, you're back? Something to prove after last week's effort? Let's see what you've got.

title.children: You won a trivia night once? Cute. Now itâs time to play, HARD!

image.altText: An illustration of a persons head with a small pink creature inside representing the amygdala

props.synopsis: Most people have heard of premenstrual syndrome or PMS, but not many have heard of the much more severe premenstrual dysphoric disorder â which can make sufferers extremely unwell and struggle to function.

title.children: Emma had to 'fake' feeling normal because of a condition that many don't know existsÂ

image.altText: A police officer's torso showing a body cam

props.synopsis: The Liberals promise to "crack down" on young offenders is "about ensuring tough love", the police minister says, but others blast the election promise coming so soon after the "horror" findings at an inquiry into Tasmania's youth prison.

title.children: Liberals to target TikTok 'crimfluencers' in election promise to 'crack down' on crime in Tasmania

image.altText: Gough Whitlam in grey suit, blue striped tie, pours soil into Indigenous man Vincent Lingiari who wears blue shirt, tie.

props.synopsis: Gurindji traditional owners want schoolkids and tourists to be able to walk the old fence line Vincent Lingiari and his people followed in the 60s. But they say the heritage area's condition is "really sad".Â

title.children: It's one of Australia's most famous photos, but the birthplace of land rights has seen better days

props.synopsis: The sunken vessel spills fertiliser and oil into the Red Sea, threatening aÂ vibrant fishing industry, some of the world's largest coral reefs and desalination plants supplying millions with drinking water.

title.children: Cargo ship attacked by Houthi rebels sinks in Red Sea

image.altText: A person is seen in silhouette standing at the rear hatch of a plane as parachutes are seen falling from the back

props.synopsis: The United States drops 38,000 meals into Gaza and a US official says Israel has endorsed a framework for a ceasefire and hostage release deal.

title.children: US drops aid into Gaza where UN says 550,000 close to famine

image.altText: Police escort protesters out of the Mardi Gras parade.

props.synopsis: Nine pro-Palestinian protesters were arrested on Oxford Street as thousands of revellers took part in Mardi Gras festivities on Saturday, which this year also honoured Jesse Baird and Luke Davies.

title.children: Protesters arrested at Sydney Mardi Gras as thousands turn out to celebrate

image.altText: Rossy Smith smiling next to two children.

props.synopsis: Despite homophobia, cultural taboos and misinformation, when beloved gay uncle Rossy Smith died of AIDS, it changed First Nations health forever.

title.children: âThey said we couldnât name a football tournament after a gay, black man with AIDS'. It was one of the most successful events ever

image.altText: Screengrabs from Barbie and Oppenheimer

props.synopsis: Some big records could fall at this year's Academy Awards, whichÂ Oppenheimer enters with an impressive 13 nominations.

title.children: Will Oppenheimer make a bang with a record-breaking Oscar haul?

image.altText: A moth with thick green stripes across its wings and a brown and black tip.

props.synopsis: Citizen scientist Dion Maple has a special interest in moths. His favourite is the crayon emerald but it's another rare species that is proving tantalisingly elusive. He unwittingly photographed it years ago and hasn't been able to find it since.

title.children: Rare moths among citizen scientist's 15k nature observations

image.altText: A graphic showing the faces of a woman with dark curly hair and an older man white white hair, with missing in the background.

props.synopsis: Ric Blum had a history of multiple aliases, fraud and a pattern of exploiting vulnerable women, an inquest has heard.

title.children: Marion Barter believed she was in a relationship with Ric Blum before she disappeared. Who is he?

image.altText: A woman with cropped blonde hair and glasses dressed as a penguin, speaking to a class of children

props.synopsis: Severe heatwave conditions around the country see students swelter through their first weeks of school, sparking calls for the government to properly address rising temperatures in classrooms.

title.children: Back to school heatwaves expose aging public school infrastructure

image.altText: Jason Clare looks serious while listening to a journalist in the Parliament House courtyard.

props.synopsis: After more than a year, Education Minister Jason Clare has the reports from three major reviews of the education system. He wanted 'spiky ideas' and got them in spades, but what will he do with them?

title.children: The government has its map for education reform. Where to now?

image.altText: Side-on photo of a young woman waterskiing. She wears a bright coloured helmet.

props.synopsis: Maddi Boyer pushed her mental demons aside to overcome a fear of falling after she fractured her skull in a competition accident.Â She now shines in a sport that almost took everything from her.

title.children: Ski racer fights her way back to the top of sport that nearly claimed her life

image.altText: Young daughter Alijana Papas (8) sitting on mother Johanna Papas lap in their kitchen looking into her eyes.

props.synopsis: Alijana Papas' life could have been far different had she not contracted meningococcal B as a baby. A vaccine is available, but only a handful of states and territories include it in their national immunisation schedule.

title.children: Governments urged to offer vaccine for deadly disease as cases rise across the country

image.altText: A small fuzzy mammal that's black with white spots

props.synopsis: When it comes to blending in, there's a lot we can learn from the animal kingdom.Â And while the reasons for camouflage vary, they all come back to survival.

title.children: Why the quoll got its spots and other animal camouflage questions answered
